newsitem.title: USA: Media General ends deal to buy paper.
newsitem.headline: Media General ends deal to buy paper.

text.p: Media General Inc. said Wednesday it called off a $42 million deal to buy California's Eureka Times-Standard newspaper from Garden State Newspapers Inc.

"Our agreement in principle was based upon our understanding of certain projections and assumptions at that time," Chairman Stewart Bryan said in a statement. "Upon detailed inspection, we found the original price to be unrealistic and declined to pursue the purchase on its original terms."
The newspaper is based in Eureka, Calif.
Garden State Newspapers, a privately held company, could not be reached immediately for comment.
Media General, based in Richmond, Va., has interests in newspapers, broadcast and cable television, recycled newsprint production and diversified information services mainly in the Southeast.
Its stock edged up 12.5 cents to $28.75 on the American Stock Exchange in late trading.
